1.text: I AM the man that has seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

2.text: He has led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

3.text: Surely against me is he turned; he turns his hand against me all the day.

4.text: My flesh and my skin has he made old; he has broken my bones.

5.text: He has built against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

6.text: He has set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

7.text: He has hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he has made my chain heavy.

8.text: Also when I cry and shout, he shuts out my prayer.

9.text: He has enclosed my ways with hewn stone, he has made my paths crooked.

10.text: He was to me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

11.text: He has turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he has made me desolate.

12.text: He has bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

13.text: He has caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

14.text: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

15.text: He has filled me with bitterness, he has made me drunken with wormwood.

16.text: He has also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he has covered me with ashes.

17.text: And you have removed my soul far off from peace: I forgot prosperity.

18.text: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the LORD:

19.text: Remembering my affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

20.text: My soul has them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

21.text: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

22.text: It is of the LORDâ€™s mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

23.text: They are new every morning: great is your faithfulness.

24.text: The LORD is my portion, said my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

25.text: The LORD is good to them that wait for him, to the soul that seeks him.

26.text: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.

27.text: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke of his youth.

28.text: He sits alone and keeps silence, because he has borne it on him.

29.text: He puts his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

30.text: He gives his cheek to him that smites him: he is filled full with reproach.

31.text: For the LORD will not cast off for ever:

32.text: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

33.text: For he does not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

34.text: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth.

35.text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

36.text: To subvert a man in his cause, the LORD approves not.

37.text: Who is he that said, and it comes to pass, when the Lord commands it not?

38.text: Out of the mouth of the most High proceeds not evil and good?

39.text: Why does a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

40.text: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the LORD.

41.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands to God in the heavens.

42.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled: you have not pardoned.

43.text: You have covered with anger, and persecuted us: you have slain, you have not pitied.

44.text: You have covered yourself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

45.text: You have made us as the offscouring and refuse in the middle of the people.

46.text: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

47.text: Fear and a snare is come on us, desolation and destruction.

48.text: My eye runs down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

49.text: My eye trickles down, and ceases not, without any intermission.

50.text: Till the LORD look down, and behold from heaven.

51.text: My eye affects my heart because of all the daughters of my city.

52.text: My enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

53.text: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone on me.

54.text: Waters flowed over my head; then I said, I am cut off.

55.text: I called on your name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.

56.text: You have heard my voice: hide not your ear at my breathing, at my cry.

57.text: You drew near in the day that I called on you: you said, Fear not.

58.text: O LORD, you have pleaded the causes of my soul; you have redeemed my life.

59.text: O LORD, you have seen my wrong: judge you my cause.

60.text: You have seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

61.text: You have heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;

62.text: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

63.text: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their music.

64.text: Render to them a recompense, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.

65.text: Give them sorrow of heart, your curse to them.

66.text: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.
